intro: Deinbollia voltensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and fascinating species in the botanical world.
